item.title: Jezz add a quote by Mary Daly
item.description: "There are and will be those who think I have gone overboard. Let them rest assured that this assessment is correct, probably beyond their wildest imagination, and that I will continue to do so." -- Mary Daly

item.title: Jezz add a quote by Charles de Lint
item.description: "All my life I've wanted to be the kid who gets to cross over into the magical kingdom. I devoured those books by C.S. Lewis and William Dunthorn, Ellen Wentworth, Susan Cooper, and Alan Garner. When I could get them from the library, I read them out of order as I found them, and then in order, and then reread them all again, many times over. Because even when I was a child I knew it wasn't simply escape that lay on the far side of the borders of fairyland. Instinctively I knew crossing over would mean more than fleeing the constant terror and shame that was mine at that time of my life. There was a knowledge – an understanding hidden in the marrow of my bones that only I can access ― telling me that by crossing over, I'd be coming home. That's the reason I’ve yearned so desperately to experience the wonder, the mystery, the beauty of that world beyond the World As It Is. It's because I know that somewhere across the border there's a place for me. A place of safety and strength and learning, where I can become who I'm supposed to be. I've tried forever to be that person here, but whatever I manage to accomplish in the World As It Is only seems to be an echo of what I could be in that other place that lies hidden somewhere beyond the borders." -- Charles de Lint

item.title: Jezz add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Only the phoenix rises and does not descend. And everything changes. And nothing is truly lost." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Jezz add a quote by Alice Walker
item.description: "Activism is my rent for living on the planet." -- Alice Walker

item.title: Jezz add a quote by Henry Rollins
item.description: "Scar tissue is stronger than regular tissue. Realize the strength, move on." -- Henry Rollins

item.title: Jezz add a quote by Kahlil Gibran
item.description: "Many of us spend our whole lives running from feeling with the mistaken belief that you can not bear the pain. But you have already borne the pain. What you have not done is feel all you are beyond that pain." -- Kahlil Gibran

item.title: Jezz add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Fairy tales are more than true: not because they tell us that dragons exist, but because they tell us that dragons can be beaten." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Jezz add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Things need not have happened to be true. Tales and dreams are the shadow-truths that will endure when mere facts are dust and ashes, and forgot." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Jezz add a quote by Cecilia Dart-Thornton
item.description: "The measure of happiness is merely the difference between expectations and outcomes. It is not concerned with what one possesses – it is concerned with how content one is with what one possesses." -- Cecilia Dart-Thornton

item.title: Jezz add a quote by Edward Everett Hale
item.description: "I am only one, but still I am one. I cannot do everything, but still I can do something; and because I cannot do everything, I will not refuse to do something that I can do." -- Edward Everett Hale

item.title: Jezz add a quote by Marlene Dietrich
item.description: "I love quotations because it is a joy to find thoughts one might have, beautifully expressed with much authority by someone recognized wiser than oneself." -- Marlene Dietrich

item.title: Jezz add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "Longed for him. Got him. Shit." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Jezz add a quote by Pat Robertson
item.description: "[Feminism is] a socialist, anti-family, political movement that encourages women to leave their husbands, kill their children, practice witchcraft, destroy capitalism and become lesbians." -- Pat Robertson

item.title: Jezz add a quote by Audre Lorde
item.description: "When I dare to be powerful, to use my strength in the service of my vision, then it becomes less and less important whether I am afraid." -- Audre Lorde

item.title: Jezz add a quote by John M. Ford
item.description: "Every book is three books, after all; the one the writer intended, the one the reader expected, and the one that casts its shadow when the first two meet by moonlight." -- John M. Ford

item.title: Jezz add a quote by Theodore I. Rubin
item.description: "I must learn to love the fool in me--the one who feels too much, talks too much, takes too many chances, wins sometimes and loses often, lacks self-control, loves and hates, hurts and gets hurt, promises and breaks promises, laughs and cries. It alone protects me against that utterly self-controlled, masterful tyrant whom I also harbor and who would rob me of my human aliveness, humility, and dignity but for my Fool." -- Theodore I. Rubin

item.title: Jezz add a quote by Charlotte Brontë
item.description: "<i>I</i> care for myself. The more solitary, the more friendless, the more unsustained I am, the more I will respect myself." -- Charlotte Brontë

item.title: Jezz add a quote by Charles Dickens
item.description: "‎And yet I have had the weakness, and have still the weakness, to wish you to know with what a sudden mastery you kindled me, heap of ashes that I am, into fire." -- Charles Dickens

item.title: Jezz add a quote by Ernest Hemingway
item.description: "Go all the way with it. Do not back off. For once, go all the goddamn way with what matters." -- Ernest Hemingway

item.title: Jezz add a quote by Finn Butler
item.description: "Everyone who terrifies you is sixty-five percent water. And everyone you love is made of stardust, and I know sometimes you cannot even breathe deeply, and the night sky is no home, and you have cried yourself to sleep enough times that you are down to your last two percent; but nothing is infinite, not even loss. You are made of the sea and the stars, and one day you are going to find yourself again." -- Finn Butler

item.title: Jezz add a quote by Louise Erdrich
item.description: "Life will break you. Nobody can protect you from that, and living alone won't either, for solitude will also break you with its yearning. You have to love. You have to feel. It is the reason you are here on earth. You are here to risk your heart. You are here to be swallowed up. And when it happens that you are broken, or betrayed, or left, or hurt, or death brushes near, let yourself sit by an apple tree and listen to the apples falling all around you in heaps, wasting their sweetness. Tell yourself you tasted as many as you could." -- Louise Erdrich
